abstract_summ: Conclusion This study showed that sampled Sudanese residents have incomplete knowledge and poor practices towards COVID-19.The aim of this study is to investigate the knowledge, practice and attitudes (KAP) of secondary school at the time of COVID-19 pandemic in Italy.Since no successful treatment and vaccine have been reported, efforts to enhance the knowledge, attitudes, and practice of the public, especially the high-risk groups, are critical to manage COVID-19 pandemic.CONCLUSIONS: The status of knowledge and desirable practices were not sufficient enough to combat this rapidly spreading virus.The questionnaire consisted of 26 questions including 15 items about COVID-19 related knowledge, 9 items regarding preventive measures and 2 items about COVID-19 risk perception.
title_summ: Knowledge, Attitude and Practice among Healthcare Professionals regarding COVID-19: A cross-sectional survey from PakistanKnowledge and practice of preventive measures against COVID-19 infection among pregnant women in a low-resource African settingA Preliminary Assessment of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) Knowledge and Perceptions in NigeriaKnowledge, perceptions and preventive practices towards COVID-19 early in the outbreak among Jimma university medical center visitors, Southwest EthiopiaKnowledge, Attitude and Practice Towards COVID-19 Among Chronic Disease Patients at Addis Zemen Hospital, Northwest EthiopiaMedical Students and COVID-19: Knowledge, Attitudes, and Precautionary Measures.Knowledge, attitudes, and practices of Sudanese residents towards COVID-19.Knowledge, attitude and practice of secondary school students toward COVID-19 epidemic in Italy: a cross selectional studyCorona Virus Disease 2019 (COVID-19): Knowledge, attitudes, practices (KAP) and misconceptions in the general population of Katsina State, NigeriaKnowledge, attitude, and practices of Community pharmacists about COVID-19: A cross-sectional survey in two provinces of Pakistan.An analytical study on the awareness, attitude and practice during the COVID-19 pandemic in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia.Awareness among under graduate students of Mangalore city regarding novel coronavirus (COVID-19) - A questionnaire study.COVID-19 and Iranian Medical Students; A Survey on Their Related-Knowledge, Preventive Behaviors and Risk Perception.
title_abstract_phrases: The questionnaire consisted of 26 questions including 15 items about COVID-19 related knowledge, 9 items regarding preventive measures and 2 items about COVID-19 risk perception.Knowledge, attitudes, and practices of Sudanese residents towards COVID-19.Background Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a severe acute respiratory infection caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2).HCPs perceived that limited infection control material and poor knowledge regarding transmission of COVID-19 are the major barriers in infection control practice.Conclusion: The study showed that most of the participants had adequate knowledge of preventive measures against COVID-19 infection but the practice of these preventive measures were poor among the participants.Both bivariable and multivariable logistic regression analyses with a 95% confidence interval were fitted to identify factors associated with poor knowledge and practice towards COVID-19.
